sections.name: Jekkajak
sections.text: This creature did not include a description.

link.name: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 62

link.name: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 62
link.alt: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 62

traits.name: Unique
traits.text: A rules element with this trait is one-of-a-kind. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to creatures with this trait is increased by 10.

traits.name: Lawful
traits.text: Lawful effects often manipulate energy from law-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to chaotic divine servants or divine servants of chaotic deities. A creature with this trait is lawful in alignment.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

traits.name: Kobold
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the kobold ancestry. Kobolds are reptilian humanoids who are usually Small and typically have darkvision. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by kobolds.

link.name: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 62
link.alt: Crown of the Kobold King pg. 62

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still use your Strength modifier when calculating damage.

traits.name: Versatile
traits.text: A versatile weapon can be used to deal a different type of damage than that listed in the Damage entry. This trait indicates the alternate damage type. For instance, a piercing weapon that is versatile S can be used to deal piercing or slashing damage. You choose the damage type each time you make an attack.

ability.name: Smoky Retreat

traits.name: Divine
traits.text: This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Evocation
traits.text: Effects and magic items with this trait are associated with the evocation school of magic, typically involving energy and elemental forces.

traits.name: Move
traits.text: An action with this trait involves moving from one space to another.

ability.requirement: Jekkajak is adjacent to at least one enemy
ability.effect: Jekkajak squeals in fright as she exhales a noxious cloud of stinking smoke. This smoke fills a 10-foot emanation around her and grants concealment to all creatures within the smoke. In addition, any non-kobold starting their turn in the smoke must succeed at a DC 21 Fortitude save or become sickened 1 by the foul smoke (or sickened 2 on a critical failure). Once created, the cloud of smoke is immobile and persists for 3 rounds. Jekkajak can move up to her Speed, but she must end her movement in a space that isn't adjacent to any enemies. This is a 2nd-level spell that requires a somatic component.
